enum.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT
enum.description: Micro air vehicle / autopilot classes. This identifies the individual model.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_RESERVED
entry.description: Reserved for future use.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_SLUGS
entry.description: SLUGS autopilot, http://slugsuav.soe.ucsc.edu

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_ARDUPILOTMEGA
entry.description: ArduPilot - Plane/Copter/Rover/Sub/Tracker, https://ardupilot.org

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_OPENPILOT
entry.description: OpenPilot, http://openpilot.org

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot only supporting simple waypoints

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_AND_SIMPLE_NAVIGATION_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting waypoints and other simple navigation commands

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_MISSION_FULL
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting the full mission command set

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID
entry.description: No valid autopilot, e.g. a GCS or other MAVLink component

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_PPZ
entry.description: PPZ UAV - http://nongnu.org/paparazzi

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_UDB
entry.description: UAV Dev Board

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_FP
entry.description: FlexiPilot

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_PX4
entry.description: PX4 Autopilot - http://px4.io/

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_SMACCMPILOT
entry.description: SMACCMPilot - http://smaccmpilot.org

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_AUTOQUAD
entry.description: AutoQuad -- http://autoquad.org

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_ARMAZILA
entry.description: Armazila -- http://armazila.com

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_AEROB
entry.description: Aerob -- http://aerob.ru

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_ASLUAV
entry.description: ASLUAV autopilot -- http://www.asl.ethz.ch

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_SMARTAP
entry.description: SmartAP Autopilot - http://sky-drones.com

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_AIRRAILS
entry.description: AirRails - http://uaventure.com

enum.name: MAV_TYPE
enum.description: MAVLINK component type reported in HEARTBEAT message. Flight controllers must report the type of the vehicle on which they are mounted (e.g. MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR). All other components must report a value appropriate for their type (e.g. a camera must use MAV_TYPE_CAMERA).

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic micro air vehicle

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_FIXED_WING
entry.description: Fixed wing aircraft.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_QUADROTOR
entry.description: Quadrotor

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_COAXIAL
entry.description: Coaxial helicopter

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_HELICOPTER
entry.description: Normal helicopter with tail rotor.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ANTENNA_TRACKER
entry.description: Ground installation

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GCS
entry.description: Operator control unit / ground control station

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_AIRSHIP
entry.description: Airship, controlled

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_FREE_BALLOON
entry.description: Free balloon, uncontrolled

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ROCKET
entry.description: Rocket

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GROUND_ROVER
entry.description: Ground rover

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_SURFACE_BOAT
entry.description: Surface vessel, boat, ship

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_SUBMARINE
entry.description: Submarine

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_HEXAROTOR
entry.description: Hexarotor

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_OCTOROTOR
entry.description: Octorotor

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_TRICOPTER
entry.description: Tricopter

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_FLAPPING_WING
entry.description: Flapping wing

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_KITE
entry.description: Kite

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ONBOARD_CONTROLLER
entry.description: Onboard companion controller

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_DUOROTOR
entry.description: Two-rotor VTOL using control surfaces in vertical operation in addition. Tailsitter.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_QUADROTOR
entry.description: Quad-rotor VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Tailsitter.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_TILTROTOR
entry.description: Tiltrotor VTOL

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_RESERVED2
entry.description: VTOL reserved 2

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_RESERVED3
entry.description: VTOL reserved 3

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_RESERVED4
entry.description: VTOL reserved 4

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_VTOL_RESERVED5
entry.description: VTOL reserved 5

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GIMBAL
entry.description: Gimbal

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ADSB
entry.description: ADSB system

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_PARAFOIL
entry.description: Steerable, nonrigid airfoil

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_DODECAROTOR
entry.description: Dodecarotor

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_CAMERA
entry.description: Camera

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_CHARGING_STATION
entry.description: Charging station

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_FLARM
entry.description: FLARM collision avoidance system

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_SERVO
entry.description: Servo

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_ODID
entry.description: Open Drone ID. See https://mavlink.io/en/services/opendroneid.html.

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_DECAROTOR
entry.description: Decarotor

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entry.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly. Additional note: this flag is to be ignore when sent in the command MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE and MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM shall be used instead. The flag can still be used to report the armed state.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_MANUAL_INPUT_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b01000000 remote control input is enabled.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies waypoints / mission items.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_CUSTOM_MODE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000001 Reserved for future use.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION
enum.description: These values encode the bit positions of the decode position. These values can be used to read the value of a flag bit by combining the base_mode variable with AND with the flag position value. The result will be either 0 or 1, depending on if the flag is set or not.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_SAFETY
entry.description: First bit: 10000000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_MANUAL
entry.description: Second bit: 01000000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_HIL
entry.description: Third bit: 00100000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_STABILIZE
entry.description: Fourth bit: 00010000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_GUIDED
entry.description: Fifth bit: 00001000

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_AUTO
entry.description: Sixth bit: 00000100

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_TEST
entry.description: Seventh bit: 00000010

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION_CUSTOM_MODE
entry.description: Eighth bit: 00000001

entry.name: MAV_STATE_UNINIT
entry.description: Uninitialized system, state is unknown.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_BOOT
entry.description: System is booting up.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_FLIGHT_TERMINATION
entry.description: System is terminating itself.

enum.name: MAV_COMPONENT
enum.description: Component ids (values) for the different types and instances of onboard hardware/software that might make up a MAVLink system (autopilot, cameras, servos, GPS systems, avoidance systems etc.). Components must use the appropriate ID in their source address when sending messages. Components can also use IDs to determine if they are the intended recipient of an incoming message. The MAV_COMP_ID_ALL value is used to indicate messages that must be processed by all components. When creating new entries, components that can have multiple instances (e.g. cameras, servos etc.) should be allocated sequential values. An appropriate number of values should be left free after these components to allow the number of instances to be expanded.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ALL
entry.description: Target id (target_component) used to broadcast messages to all components of the receiving system. Components should attempt to process messages with this component ID and forward to components on any other interfaces. Note: This is not a valid *source* component id for a message.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_AUTOPILOT1
entry.description: System flight controller component ("autopilot"). Only one autopilot is expected in a particular system.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_USER1
entry.description: Id for a component on privately managed MAVLink network. Can be used for any purpose but may not be published by components outside of the private network.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_MISSIONPLANNER
entry.description: Component that can generate/supply a mission flight plan (e.g. GCS or developer API).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ONBOARD_COMPUTER
entry.description: Component that lives on the onboard computer (companion computer) and has some generic functionalities, such as settings system parameters and monitoring the status of some processes that don't directly speak mavlink and so on.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_PATHPLANNER
entry.description: Component that finds an optimal path between points based on a certain constraint (e.g. minimum snap, shortest path, cost, etc.).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_OBSTACLE_AVOIDANCE
entry.description: Component that plans a collision free path between two points.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_VISUAL_INERTIAL_ODOMETRY
entry.description: Component that provides position estimates using VIO techniques.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_PAIRING_MANAGER
entry.description: Component that manages pairing of vehicle and GCS.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_IMU
entry.description: Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) #1.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_IMU_2
entry.description: Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) #2.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_IMU_3
entry.description: Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU) #3.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_GPS
entry.description: GPS #1.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_GPS2
entry.description: GPS #2.

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ODID_TXRX_1
entry.description: Open Drone ID transmitter/receiver (Bluetooth/WiFi/Internet).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ODID_TXRX_2
entry.description: Open Drone ID transmitter/receiver (Bluetooth/WiFi/Internet).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_ODID_TXRX_3
entry.description: Open Drone ID transmitter/receiver (Bluetooth/WiFi/Internet).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_UDP_BRIDGE
entry.description: Component to bridge MAVLink to UDP (i.e. from a UART).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_UART_BRIDGE
entry.description: Component to bridge to UART (i.e. from UDP).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_TUNNEL_NODE
entry.description: Component handling TUNNEL messages (e.g. vendor specific GUI of a component).

entry.name: MAV_COMP_ID_SYSTEM_CONTROL
entry.deprecated: System control does not require a separate component ID.
entry.description: Component for handling system messages (e.g. to ARM, takeoff, etc.).

message.name: HEARTBEAT
message.description: The heartbeat message shows that a system or component is present and responding. The type and autopilot fields (along with the message component id), allow the receiving system to treat further messages from this system appropriately (e.g. by laying out the user interface based on the autopilot). This microservice is documented at https://mavlink.io/en/services/heartbeat.html
message.field: Vehicle or component type. For a flight controller component the vehicle type (quadrotor, helicopter, etc.). For other components the component type (e.g. camera, gimbal, etc.). This should be used in preference to component id for identifying the component type.
Autopilot type / class. Use MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID for components that are not flight controllers.
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags
MAVLink version, not writable by user, gets added by protocol because of magic data type: uint8_t_mavlink_version
